title: Pennsylvania man arrested after allegedly trying to bring explosives in his suitcase on a flight
description: Federal agents arrested a Pennsylvania man on Monday who allegedly tried to bring explosives in his suitcase on a flight to Florida.

title: Hubble Space Telescope captured 'movie' of spacecraft slamming into asteroid
description: When a NASA spacecraft intentionally crashed into an asteroid on September 26, the collision caused the space rock to release a cometlike tail.

title: Alex Murdaugh's life was a 'gathering storm' before murders, prosecutor says
Baby's body found close to where UK aristocrat and partner were arrested
description: The body of a baby has been found in a woodland area in southern England, close to where aristocrat Constance Marten and her partner Mark Gordon were arrested earlier this week over concerns for their child's welfare, UK authorities said Wednesday.

title: Man claims mummy found inside delivery bag as his 'spiritual girlfriend' 'Juanita'
description: A pre-Hispanic mummy, estimated to be between 600 to 800 years old, was discovered in a food delivery cooler bag by Peruvian police over the weekend. Police told CNN that the mummified remains were found with three men drinking in a deserted park in the Peruvian city of Puno on Saturday afternoon. CNN's Tom Foreman has more details.

title: Russian fighters are edging into the city of Bakhmut. Here's what you need to know
description: Russian forces are edging closer and closer to capturing the city of Bakhmut, after weeks of bloody fighting gradually wore down a resolute Ukrainian resistance.

title: Putin says Russia's economy is strong. Biden disagrees. Here's the reality
description: After a year of punishing sanctions, oil price caps, and international companies exiting the country, the IMF predicts Russia's economy could actually grow in 2023. CNN's Christine Romans breaks what's happening with the Russian economy.

title: Chef lauded as world's best loses Michelin star
description: Guy Savoy, who has been praised as the world's best chef, has lost one of his Michelin stars.

title: Netanyahu official says West Bank village should be 'erased'
description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich is receiving backlash after saying the West Bank village of Huwara "needs to be erased" in response to the death of two Israeli citizens. CNN's Jerusalem Correspondent Hadas Gold reports.

title: French soccer legend Just Fontaine dies aged 89
description: French soccer legend Just Fontaine, who still holds the record for most goals scored by a player at a single World Cup, has died aged 89, the French Football Federation (FFF) announced.

title: Closing arguments begin in Murdaugh murder trial after jury visits property where wife and son were killed
description: State prosecutors began closing arguments Wednesday in the murder trial of Alex Murdaugh, the disbarred South Carolina attorney accused of killing his wife and son at the family's countryside estate in 2021.

title: Closing arguments begin in Alex Murdaugh's murder trial after jury visits family property where his wife and son were killed
description: State prosecutors began closing arguments Wednesday in the murder trial of Alex Murdaugh, the disbarred South Carolina attorney accused of killing his wife and son at the family's countryside estate in 2021.

title: See what happens when parrot lands on ump during game
description: Parrot lands on umpire during game but he doesn't call a fowl ball. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Nerds, assemble! 'Stranger Things' is coming back -- as a London stage play
description: Fans bracing themselves to say goodbye to "Stranger Things" after its fifth and final season may not have to do so after all.

title: Hear what Iran's foreign minister said about its nuclear program
description: CNN chief international anchor Christiane Amanpour asks Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian about the country's nuclear program and if there's any chance it would reenter the nuclear deal. The full interview airs at 1pm ET on CNN International.

title: Japanese hotel boss apologizes for only changing water in spa bath twice a year
description: The boss of a 158-year-old Japanese guesthouse has apologized for only changing the water in its spa bath twice a year, after it was found to be teeming with potentially deadly bacteria.

title: Why the northern and southern lights appear to be so active right now
description: The breathtaking dancing shimmer of the aurora borealis and its counterpart in the southern hemisphere, aurora australis, dazzles those lucky enough to catch a glimpse of Earth's greatest light show.

title: A 700-year-old chair is getting a facelift for King Charles III's coronation
description: A conservator at London's Westminster Abbey is carrying out meticulous restoration work on a fragile 700-year-old chair to ensure King Charles III can sit on it at his coronation in May.

title: Jalen Carter facing charges in fatal crash, police say alcohol and speed were a factor
description: University of Georgia's star defensive lineman Jalen Carter — projected as a top pick in the upcoming NFL draft — is facing charges of reckless driving and racing in connection with a crash that killed teammate Devin Willock and team employee Chandler LeCroy, according to Athens-Clarke County police.

title: The 5 airplane near crashes under investigation
description: Phil Washington, the White House's pick to lead the Federal Aviation Administration, is going to face tough questions in his confirmation hearing about his ability to lead an agency facing the challenges the agency faces.

title: US imposes sanctions on three companies and two individuals for 'illicitly' generating income for North Korea
description: The US Treasury Department on Wednesday imposed sanctions on three companies and two individuals for "illicitly" generating income for the North Korean government.

title: Who is Nigeria's new President-elect Bola Tinubu?
description: Bola Ahmed Tinubu is the winner of a closely fought contest for Nigeria's presidency. But who is the man who will lead Africa's largest economy -- as well as inherit its plethora of economic and security crises?

title: Gulf states have given billions in aid to Egypt. Now they want to see returns
description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi last month sent a message to his Gulf allies. "The most important point here is support from our brothers," he said at the World Government Summit (WGS) in Dubai, where he was guest of honor.

title: Covid vaccine maker Novavax says it may not survive
description: Novavax, which makes the Nuvaxovid vaccine used to treat Covid-19, posted huge sales gains for the past three years during the height of the pandemic. But the company is now facing serious financial challenges — and has even warned it may not be able to survive.

title: The top 10 most visited US National Park sites in 2022 are ...
description: The 424 sites administered by the US National Park Service (NPS) continued to rebound from the pandemic last year, and a perennial favorite once again landed in the top spot for most visited site for 2022.

title: How to see Jupiter 'kiss' Venus in the night sky
description: Jupiter and Venus will appear very close together in the night sky on Wednesday, with the two planets set to pass each other in what's known as a conjunction.

title: Abu Dhabi's stunning new multi-faith complex is a mosque, synagogue and church
description: The United Arab Emirates on Wednesday inaugurated the "Abrahamic Family House," an interfaith complex housing a mosque, a church, and the Gulf Arab state's first ever purpose-built synagogue.

title: Ex-Navy pilot says he saw UFOs that did things his plane could not do
description: Former Navy fighter pilot Ryan Graves tells CNN's Alisyn Camerota about his unit's experiences with UFOs and explains the problems they can pose for military and commercial aviation.

title: The owner of Insider and Politico tells journalists: AI is coming for your jobs
description: One of Europe's biggest media groups has warned journalists that artificial intelligence (AI) could steal their jobs, and has provided tips for how reporters can avoid the chop.

title: Twitter users were unable to view tweets in latest service disruption under Musk
description: Twitter's timeline page appeared to experience a prolonged outage on Wednesday morning, marking the latest service disruption for the platform under new owner Elon Musk.

title: Amanpour challenges Iranian foreign minister on torture allegations
description: CNN chief international anchor Christiane Amanpour asks Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian about torture and sexual abuse allegations lodged by imprisoned protesters.

title: Putin ally Lukashenko meets Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping met with Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko -- a close ally of Vladimir Putin -- on Wednesday, in a state visit that comes as the West warns China against providing lethal aid for Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: Ed Sheeran says his wife was diagnosed with tumor while pregnant
description: Ed Sheeran has revealed that his wife, Cherry Seaborn, was diagnosed with a tumor when she was pregnant with their second child.

title: When Tracey Emin became Frida Kahlo: Mary McCartney's take on two groundbreaking artists
description: In 1998, Tracey Emin rocked the contemporary art world with her brutally honest installation, "My Bed." The unkempt bed, which was shortlisted for the Turner Prize and later sold for more than $4 million, was a window into Emin's private life, strewn with used condoms, soiled underwear and a full ashtray.

title: Italian cyclist Antonio Tiberi fined after killing San Marino tourism minister's cat with air rifle
description: A court in San Marino has fined Italian professional cyclist Antonio Tiberi 4,000 euros (around $4,250) after he pleaded guilty to shooting a cat belonging to the tiny republic's minister of tourism, Federico Pedini Amati, a court spokesperson confirmed to CNN.

title: Spring training game between Baltimore Orioles and Pittsburgh Pirates ends without umpires
description: Umpires for the spring training preseason game between the Baltimore Orioles and the Pittsburgh Pirates were not fussed about working any overtime on Tuesday as they left the field before the players.

title: 'A form of resistance': More Black families are choosing to homeschool their children
description: Tracie Yorke grew concerned about the quality of education her son was receiving after his school moved to remote learning during the pandemic in 2020.

title: Still 4,500 civilians in Bakhmut as Russian forces advance, Ukrainian official says
description:
• Putin ally Lukashenko meets Chinese leader Xi
• Video: Russia's military soldiers send a surprising message to Wagner

title: Meme stocks have revolutionized investor days
description: The next generation of traders has blown the doors off an elitist Wall Street ritual, with Goldman Sachs, Chevron and Tesla all holding glitzy and widely publicized "investor days" this week in place of an intimate conference with shareholders.

title: Girls high school basketball team forfeits tournament rather than play against transgender player
description: A Vermont girls high school basketball team forfeited an out of state tournament after refusing to play against a team that had a transgender player.

title: Near bomb-grade level uranium found in Iranian nuclear plant, says IAEA report
description: Uranium particles enriched to near bomb-grade levels have been found at an Iranian nuclear facility, according to the UN's nuclear watchdog, as the US warned that Tehran's ability to build a nuclear bomb was accelerating.

title: Justin Bieber cancels remaining Justice World Tour dates
description: Justin Bieber fans waiting eagerly for new dates for his postponed international tour have been told the shows won't be going ahead.

title: Greta Thunberg has joined a protest against wind farms. Here's why.
description: It may seem strange to see Greta Thunberg protesting against wind turbines, but this week the Swedish climate activist has joined Indigenous and environmental groups in Norway to do just that.

title: UK house prices post sharpest fall since 2012 as high mortgage rates hurt
description: UK house prices last month saw their biggest annual decline since November 2012, in the latest indication of the lasting pain that former Prime Minister Liz Truss's ill-fated "mini" budget inflicted on Britain's property market.

title: Paul Pogba makes long-awaited return to football in Juventus' 4-2 win against Torino
description: Paul Pogba made his long-awaited return to football after almost a year on the sidelines in Juventus' 4-2 win against city rival Torino in Serie A.

title: A flight attendant's secrets to surviving long-haul flights
description: Any air travel can be stressful, but facing down a long-haul flight can be especially intimidating.

title: DNA found on a sweet potato helps Massachusetts police solve 12-year-old cold case murder
description: More than a decade after 31-year-old Todd Lampley was fatally shot in a Massachusetts home, authorities have arrested and charged a suspect who was identified with the help of DNA found on a sweet potato found at the scene, court records show.

title: Greek prime minister heads to scene of train collision
Mainly young people on board Greek train, hospital chief says after fatal collision
TikTok to set one-hour daily screen time limit by default for users under 18
description: TikTok announced Wednesday that every user under 18 will soon have their accounts default to a one-hour daily screen time limit, in one of the most aggressive moves yet by a social media company to prevent teens from endlessly scrolling.

title: A mysterious fleet is helping Russia ship oil around the world. And it's growing
Newcastle United fan left red-faced after premature celebratory tattoo
description: Newcastle United fan Kris Cook was so convinced his club was going to win a first domestic trophy for nearly 70 years that he had a tattoo celebrating the fact on his leg.

title: San Diego Padres sign Manny Machado to 11-year contract extension reportedly for $350 million
description: The San Diego Padres have signed third baseman Manny Machado to a new 11-year contract through the 2033 season, the team announced Tuesday.

title: 'The whole of Europe is mourning with you,' says EU chief after Greek train disaster
At least 38 killed as trains collide in Greece
A mysterious fleet is helping Russia ship oil around the world. And it's growing
description: Russian oil is still finding its way to buyers around the world. But even those who spend their days tracking its movement across oceans struggle to work out exactly who is ferrying it.

title: This enduring crime continues to haunt America's efforts for racial justice
description: The recent news that the family of Malcolm X announced plans to file a $100 million wrongful death lawsuit against a phalanx of law enforcement agencies, including the NYPD, CIA and FBI coincided with the 58th anniversary of his assassination at the Audubon Ballroom in Washington Heights, New York. Ilyasah Shabazz, one of Malcolm's six daughters, announced the suit at the site of her father's death, standing alongside noted civil rights attorney Benjamin Crump. "We'd like our father to receive the justice that he deserves," explained Shabazz.

title: Drone footage shows scene at train crash that killed dozens
description: Drone footage shows the scene in Tempi, central Greece, where 38 people have died after a passenger and freight train collided. CNN's Eleni Giokos reports.

title: Why camel cloning is big business in Dubai
description: When Nisar Ahmad Wani succeeded in carrying out the world's first camel cloning in 2009, it was hailed as a great achievement. Today, Wani is scientific director at the Reproductive Biotechnology Centre, in Dubai, and the practice is so popular that cloning has become his nine-to-five job.

title: Meet the 4 men tipped to run China's economy
description: The team of Communist Party officials running China's economy is about to get a major makeover.

title: Watch: Historic flight takes two paragliders up world's second tallest mountain
description: Paragliders spent four weeks on the Baltoro Glacier in Pakistan-controlled Kashmir attempting to fly up the face of K2 - the world's second tallest mountain.

title: Japan births fall to record low as population crisis deepens
description: The number of births registered in Japan plummeted to another record low last year -- the latest worrying statistic in a decades-long decline that the country's authorities have failed to reverse despite their extensive efforts.

title: Russian forces are pounding Bakhmut, but city isn't surrounded: Ukrainian officials
description: • Video: Russia's military soldiers send a surprising message to Wagner

title: Nestlé to close factory, office in Myanmar
description: Nestlé has announced that it will close its sole factory and head office in Yangon, Myanmar's largest city, as it switches to a more "sustainable" business model amid ongoing turmoil in the country.

title: India, world's largest democracy, leads global list of internet shutdowns
description: India imposed the highest number of internet shutdowns globally in 2022, a new report has revealed, in what critics say is yet another blow to country's commitment to freedom of speech and access to information.

title: Moscow accuses Ukraine of multiple attempted drone strikes inside Russian territory
description:
• Live updates: Toughest battle for Ukraine is around Bakhmut, Zelensky says
• Video: Russia's military soldiers send a surprising message to Wagner

title: Moscow accuses Ukraine of multiple attempted drone strikes deep inside Russian territory
FBI director acknowledges bureau assessment that Covid likely resulted from China lab incident
China's factories just had their best month in nearly 11 years as economy rebounds after reopening
description: China's factory activity has expanded at the fastest pace in more than a decade, as the world's second largest economy staged what economists are calling a "very rapid" rebound after reopening from zero-Covid.

title: Watch the best moments from Jake Tapper's one-on-one with Bill Maher
description: Jake Tapper sits down with comedian and political commentator Bill Maher for a special one-on-one "CNN Primetime" conversation.

title: Hear Bill Maher's prediction for 2024 election
description: In an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper, comedian Bill Maher explains how he thinks the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election could unfold. See other moments from their hourlong sit down here.

title: Vanessa Bryant reaches nearly $29M settlement with LA County over Kobe Bryant crash photos
description: Vanessa Bryant has reached a nearly $30 million agreement with Los Angeles County to settle a lawsuit over photos that were taken at the 2020 helicopter crash that killed her husband, Los Angeles Lakers star Kobe Bryant, her daughter Gianna Bryant and seven others.

title: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot will lose reelection bid, CNN projects
description: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot lost her bid for a second term Tuesday, failing to make a top-two runoff in the latest demonstration of growing concerns about crime in one of the nation's largest cities.

title: Bola Ahmed Tinubu elected Nigeria's president as opposition call for new polls
description: Bola Ahmed Tinubu has been declared the winner of Nigeria's controversial presidential elections, as opposition leaders decry the polls as rigged and call for a fresh vote.

title: China rolls out red carpet for key Putin ally
EU bans TikTok from official devices across all three government institutions
description: The European Parliament on Tuesday banned TikTok from staff devices over cybersecurity concerns, meaning the Chinese video-sharing app is now barred in all three of the EU's main institutions.

title: 90% of ice around Antartica has disappeared in less than a decade
description: Scientists say Antarctic sea ice has reached record low levels for the second time in less than a decade. CNN's chief climate correspondent Bill Weir reports.

title: Wagner Group propaganda video: Recruits will be 'in good shape for the upcoming WW3'
description: New videos show Russian forces targeting Bakhmut, Ukraine with warplanes, while Wagner Group mercenaries target the ground. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Hear Bill Maher's definition of 'woke'
description: Jake Tapper sits down with comedian and political commentator Bill Maher for a special one-on-one "CNN Primetime" conversation. Watch Tuesday, February 28, at 9 p.m. ET.

title: FBI director acknowledges bureau assessment that Covid likely resulted from China lab incident
description: • US bipartisan lawmakers warn of China threat

title: At least 16 dead, 85 injured as trains collide in Greece
description: At least 16 people have been killed and 85 injured after two trains collided near the city of Larissa in Greece late Tuesday night, Reuters reported, citing authorities.

title: Bipartisan lawmakers warn of China threat at select committee's first hearing
description: Bipartisan lawmakers warned of the threat posed by the Chinese Communist Party on Thursday during the first hearing of the House select committee on China, a rare demonstration of unity across the aisle in a Congress increasingly divided along partisan lines.

title: See college president's frosty reception after appointment from DeSantis-backed board members
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis replaced 6 of 13 board members of New College with his own appointees, who then voted to appoint a new president with ties to DeSantis. CNN's Erin Burnett speaks with New College associate professor Liz Leininger.

title: Russian soldiers plead in video message to join Putin's Wagner Group
description: CNN's Erin Burnett obtains video appearing to show Russian soldiers pleading to join the private military organization Wagner Group.

title: See how Ukrainian team works to defuse Russian mines
description: CNN's Alex Marquardt reports from Eastern Ukraine in areas now liberated from Russia where Ukraine teams are working to defuse mines and clear traps left by Russians.
